zup.name: Senior Software Engineer - Zup Innovation
zup.description:
I work in the insurance area of a client in the banking/finance sector. As I did many things, I will give just one example of a project:
Situation 1: Many clients made the quote and started contracting an insurance proposal, but forgot to formalize the proposal (to formalize means agreeing with the proposal).
My task: Design and implement a solution to schedule actions (e.g. email/communication) to be executed every 3 days after the proposal enters the awaiting formalization state.
Actions I took to complete the task: 1 - Understand the microservices architecture of my team and where my solution should be placed. 2 - Research about the architecture of scheduling systems and what cloud services could be used for this purpose. 3 - Bring and discuss solutions with the team. 4 - Implement the solution chosen by the team.
Results: It was not a requirement of the project to define and collect success metrics but I collected logs in production that showed that 17k insurance proposals were formalized in a period of 1 year because of these reminders.
Technologies involved: TypeScript, Java, AWS Lambda, AWS ECS, AWS EventBridge Scheduler, AWS SNS/SQS, AWS DynamoDB.

google.name: Software Engineer - Google
google.description:
I worked within the Google Search product area as a software engineer maintaining Data Engineering solutions (eg Map/Reduce) that process billions of logs every day and help Google evaluate its own products through satisfaction surveys sent directly to real users (eg Google Opinion Rewards App). Technologies involved: C++, RPC/gRPC, Protocol Buffers, Java, Python and relational databases.
I also worked on some additional projects:
In the 1st project I was responsible for creating routines that process billions of data points and generate tables that are later used to create dashboards that help monitor the health of an internal system (I created the dashboards too). All technologies involved are internal.
In the 2nd project I was responsible for collaborating on the design of a feature where internal users can create UI components through configuration files and I created the entire front end that supports this architecture. Technologies involved: Google Cloud, React, GraphQL, TypeScript, JavaScript and Node.js.
In the 3rd project I worked as front and back end developing UI components that help internal users build satisfaction surveys. Technologies involved: Google Cloud, C++, RPC/gRPC, Protocol Buffers, Kotlin, TypeScript, React, GraphQL, Node.js and relational databases.

accenture.name: Application Development Analyst - Accenture
accenture.description:
In the 1st project, I was assigned to understand a need of the SAP team and create a solution from scratch, including layout, frontend (React), backend (Node), database (Postgres) and infrastructure on AWS (EC2, S3 and RDS).
In the 2nd project, I worked as a React front-end technical lead. Our mission was to improve the accessibility of several websites of a large healthcare company in Brazil. This involves testing screen readers, color contrast and other things described in the WCAG standards. I helped the team both in the development of tasks and in the organization of the project (Git Flow, Code Review, CI/CD Pipelines, Technical Refinement).

internIoasys.name: Full Stack Development Intern - Ioasys
internIoasys.description:
Participation in 2 development projects.
The last one, a Ruby on Rails API with infrastructure on AWS (EC2, RDS and S3 with video upload), was the biggest challenge, as in 2 weeks I had to take over the project alone, and I was responsible for the infrastructure on AWS, the backend development, deploys and updates to the production database.
The penultimate, a Node Serverless project using AWS Lambda, was an authentication integration via SAML 2.0. I was responsible for a good part of the project cycle: conception, technical meetings with the client, development, automated tests and deployment.
